criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-reported adherence difficulties and symptom fluctuation exactly as conveyed (forgetting doses, busy schedule, symptoms worsening when doses are missed, improvement with regular use).

Reward for accurately documenting all clinician counseling, recommendations, and instructions (acknowledging difficulty, suggesting phone reminders and pill organizer, stressing consistency, requesting notification of new symptoms or side-effects).

Reward for correctly incorporating only the chart data explicitly or implicitly referenced in the encounter (29-year-old male, Crohn's disease, mesalamine 2.4 g daily) while omitting unrelated chart elements.
Reward for precise representation of critical data elements (medication name, dosage, key instructions) while appropriately summarizing less critical dialogue.
Reward for overall completeness: the note reflects every clinically pertinent fact, action, and context mentioned in the transcript with no significant omissions.
Penalize for omission or misrepresentation of any major conversational element or pertinent chart detail, leading to an incomplete or distorted note.
Penalize for inclusion of information not supported by the transcript or relevant chart (e.g., new diagnoses, vitals, lab orders, medication changes, physical exam findings).
Penalize for inaccurate or selective copying of chart data (wrong medication dose, adding unrelated history, omitting Crohn's disease while adding extraneous items).
Penalize for factual inaccuracies in demographic, medication, or quantitative details when compared with the transcript and chart.
Penalize for altering the meaning, timeline, emphasis, or speaker attribution of statements from the transcript.
